required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Positron Nuclide Labeled NOTA-FAPI PET Study in Colocrectal Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Positron Nuclide Labeled NOTA-FAPI PET and FDG PET Study in Colocrectal Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate the normal physiological distribution of positron nuclide labeled NOTA-FAPI in human body and its detection efficiency for colorectal cancers

detailed_description.textblock: Subjects first undergo an 18F-FDG test, followed by 68Ga-NOTA-FAPI04 or 18F-NOTA-FAPI04 test in groups. The purpose of the comparison of the maximum of standardized uptake value(SUVmax ) between 68Ga/18F-NOTA-FAPI04 and 18F-FDG PET/CT for the target lesion of colorectal cancer is to investigate the superiority of FAPI in diagnosis of colorectal cancer.

primary_outcome.description: Standardized uptake value of 68Ga/ 18F-NOTA-FAPI04 for target lesion of subject or suspected tumor in each time point window (SUV)

arm_group.description: Each subject receive a single intravenous injection of 18F-FDG and 68Ga-NOTA-FAPI04, and undergo PET/CT imaging within the specified time
Each subject receive a single intravenous injection of 18F-FDG and 18F-NOTA-FAPI04, and undergo PET/CT imaging within the specified time

intervention.description: Each subject receive a single intravenous injection of 18F-FDG and 68Ga-NOTA-FAPI04, and undergo PET/CT imaging within the specified time
